1.text: My spirit will be wasted, my days will be shortened, and only the grave will left for me.

2.text: I have not sinned, yet my eye remains in bitterness.

3.text: Free me, O Lord, and set me beside you, and let the hand of anyone you wish fight against me.

4.text: You have set their heart far from discipline; therefore, they will not be praised.

5.text: He promises prey to his companions, but the eyes of his sons will grow faint.

6.text: He has posted me like a proverb to the people, and I am an example in their presence.

7.text: My eyesight has been clouded by indignation, and my limbs have been reduced, as if to nothing.

8.text: The just will be astounded over this, and the innocent will be stirred up against the hypocrite.

9.text: And the just will cling to his way, and clean hands will increase strength.

10.text: Therefore, be converted, all of you, and approach, for I do not find in you any wisdom.

11.text: My days have passed away; my thoughts have been scattered, tormenting my heart.

12.text: They have turned night into day, and I hope for light again after the darkness.

13.text: If I should wait, the underworld is my house, and in darkness I have spread out my bed.

14.text: I have said to decay and to worms: “You are my father, my mother, and my sister.”

15.text: Therefore, where is my expectation now, and who is it that considers my patience?

16.text: Everything of mine will descend into the deepest underworld; do you think that, in that place at least, there will be rest for me?
